title: Update Documentation Matrix with Review Data
description:
Update corporate-grc/supporting/tez-documentation-matrix.xlsx:

1. Add two new columns after 'Temporary notes':
   - Column G: 'Review Path' - path to the review document (e.g., corporate-grc/reviews/review-cybersecurity-policy.md)
   - Column H: 'SOC 2 Score' - extracted score or status from review

2. For each document row in the matrix:
   - Match the document name (from columns A/B/C or D) to corresponding review file in corporate-grc/reviews/
   - Extract SOC 2 score/status from the review file:
     - Look for patterns like '4/5', 'APPROVED', 'AUDIT-READY', 'REVISION REQUIRED', 'REVISION RECOMMENDED', 'WITH CONDITIONS'
     - Check 'Overall Assessment' or 'SOC 2 Readiness Score' lines
   - Populate the Review Path and SOC 2 Score columns

3. Review files follow pattern: review-{document-name-kebab-case}.md
   - Example: 'Cybersecurity Policy' -> review-cybersecurity-policy.md
   - Example: 'Change Management Procedure' -> review-change-management-procedure.md

4. Use openpyxl (already installed) to read/write the xlsx file

5. Save updated xlsx and commit changes

Reference data from recent reviews:
- change-management-procedure: 4/5 APPROVED
- email-retention-policy: 4/5 APPROVED  
- equipment-return-standard: 2/5 MAJOR REVISION REQUIRED
- rbac-matrix-procedure: AUDIT-READY
- rbac-standard: APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS
- incident-response-plan-procedure: AUDIT-READY
- fraud-risk-management-policy: MINOR REVISION RECOMMENDED
- role-based-access-control-policy: REVISION RECOMMENDED
close_reason: Updated tez-documentation-matrix.xlsx with Review Path and SOC 2 Score columns. Matched 52 documents to reviews, extracted 3 explicit scores.

title: P1: Complete Metadata Headers in GRC Documents
description:
Add or complete metadata header blocks in documents missing required fields.

Documents requiring metadata updates:

1. **tez-standard-document-control.md** - Document Control Standard
   Current issues:
   - Version shows 'Draft'
   - Issue Date shows 'TBD'
   - Repository shows '???'
   
   Update to:
   - Version: 1.0
   - Date of Issue: 2026-01-04
   - Document Owner: GRC Coordinator
   - Classification: Internal
   - Next Review Date: 2027-01-04
   - Repository: corporate-grc/standard/

2. **tez-standard-procedure-control.md** - Procedure Control Standard
   Add metadata header block:
   - Version: 2.1
   - Date of Issue: 2025-12-31
   - Document Owner: GRC Coordinator
   - Classification: Internal
   - Next Review Date: 2026-12-31

3. **tez-standard-cybersecurity-program-management.md**
   Fix 'Date of Issue: None' and add:
   - Document Owner
   - Classification
   - Next Review Date

Standard metadata format:
```
Version: X.X
Date of Issue: YYYY-MM-DD
Document Owner: [Role]
Classification: Internal
Next Review Date: YYYY-MM-DD
Repository: corporate-grc/[tier]/
```

Update both .md and .docx versions.

title: Work complete: tez-3tw

title: P0: Add SOC 2/NIST Control Mappings to Policies
description:
Add explicit References sections with SOC 2 Trust Services Criteria and NIST SP 800-53 control mappings to policies missing them.

Documents requiring control mappings:

1. **tez-policy-cybersecurity.md** - Cybersecurity Policy
   Add References section with:
   - SOC 2: CC1.x (Control Environment), CC2.x (Communication), CC5.x (Control Activities), CC6.x (Logical Access), CC7.x (Operations)
   - NIST: PM-1 (Program Plan), PL-1 (Planning), CA-2 (Assessments)

2. **tez-policy-data-privacy.md** - Data Privacy Policy  
   Add References section with:
   - SOC 2: P1.x-P8.x (Privacy Criteria), CC6.x (Logical Access)
   - NIST: PT-1 (Privacy Policy), IP-1 (Consent), DM-1 (Data Minimization)

3. **tez-policy-role-based-access-control.md** - RBAC Policy
   Add References section with:
   - SOC 2: CC6.1, CC6.2, CC6.3
   - NIST: AC-2, AC-3, AC-5, AC-6

For each document:
- Add a 'References' section before appendices
- Use table format: | Control ID | Control Name | Policy Section |
- Ensure mappings align with existing content

Update both .md and .docx versions.

title: P2: Standardize SOC 2 Scores in All Review Files
description:
Add explicit, standardized SOC 2 readiness scores to all review files that lack them.

Current state: Only 3 of 62 review files have explicit scores.

For each review file in corporate-grc/reviews/:
1. Add standardized header format after Summary section:
   ```
   **Overall Assessment:** [STATUS]
   **SOC 2 Readiness Score:** [X/5]
   ```

2. Score criteria:
   - 5/5: Fully compliant, no gaps
   - 4/5: AUDIT-READY, minor enhancements only
   - 3/5: APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS, P1 items needed
   - 2/5: REVISION REQUIRED, P0 items exist
   - 1/5: MAJOR REVISION, fundamental gaps

3. Status values:
   - APPROVED / AUDIT-READY (4-5/5)
   - APPROVED WITH CONDITIONS (3/5)
   - MINOR REVISION RECOMMENDED (3/5)
   - REVISION REQUIRED (2/5)
   - MAJOR REVISION REQUIRED (1-2/5)

4. Add score rationale section at end of each review explaining the score.

This enables the documentation matrix to show consistent scores across all documents.
close_reason: Added standardized SOC 2 readiness scores and rationale sections to all 62 review files. Score distribution: 7 files at 4/5 (audit-ready), 51 files at 3/5 (minor revision), 4 files at 2/5 (revision required). All files now have consistent format with Overall Assessment and SOC 2 Readiness Score after Summary section.

title: SOC 2 Type I Audit Readiness
description:
Epic to address all blocking and high-priority gaps identified in GRC document reviews before SOC 2 Type I audit.

Priority Categories:
- P0 (Critical): Must fix before audit - blocking issues
- P1 (High): Should fix before audit - material gaps  
- P2 (Medium): Enhancements - audit defensibility improvements

Target: All documents at 4/5 SOC 2 readiness or AUDIT-READY status

Key Focus Areas:
1. Executive approval signatures (TBD → actual approvals)
2. Equipment Return Standard remediation (2/5 → 4/5)
3. SOC 2/NIST control mapping additions
4. Document cross-references and hierarchy
5. Metadata header completeness
6. Review score standardization

title: P0: Remediate Equipment Return Standard (2/5 → 4/5)
description:
Major revision of tez-standard-equipment-return.md to address critical SOC 2 gaps.

Current Score: 2/5 (MAJOR REVISION REQUIRED)
Target Score: 4/5 (AUDIT-READY)

Critical Gaps to Address:
1. **Add Media Sanitization Section (NIST MP-6)**
   - Add requirements for data wiping before equipment reuse/disposal
   - Specify sanitization methods (secure wipe, degauss, destruction)
   - Add verification step before device reallocation

2. **Add Access Revocation Timeline (SOC 2 CC6.6)**
   - Specify explicit timeline (e.g., 'within 24 hours of separation')
   - Add cross-reference to IT offboarding checklist
   - Reference Joiners/Movers/Leavers procedure

3. **Add Remote Wipe Provisions**
   - Add MDM remote wipe capability requirements
   - Define process for unreturned devices

4. **Fix Non-Compliant Withholding Clause**
   - Remove or revise Section 7.0 $2500 USD withholding provision
   - Many US states prohibit wage withholding for equipment
   - Replace with alternative recovery mechanisms

5. **Add JML Integration**
   - Cross-reference Joiners/Movers/Leavers procedure
   - Ensure equipment return is part of documented offboarding

6. **Resolve Document Hierarchy**
   - Clarify relationship with Equipment Distribution and Return Policy
   - Either merge or clearly differentiate scope

Update both .md and .docx versions.

title: P1: Add Missing Document Cross-References
description:

Documents requiring cross-reference updates:

1. **tez-policy-role-based-access-control.md** - RBAC Policy
   Add references to:
   - tez-standard-role-based-access-control.md (implements policy requirements)
   - tez-standard-identity-management-and-access-control.md (parent access control framework)
   - tez-procedure-joiners-movers-leavers.md (provisioning/deprovisioning workflow)

2. **tez-standard-procedure-control.md** - Procedure Control Standard
   Add reference to:
   - Parent policy (likely Cybersecurity Policy or Governance Policy)

3. **tez-standard-equipment-return.md** - Equipment Return Standard
   Add references to:
   - tez-policy-equipment-distribution-and-return.md (parent policy)
   - tez-procedure-joiners-movers-leavers.md (offboarding workflow)

4. **tez-policy-cybersecurity.md** - Cybersecurity Policy
   Add references to all child standards/procedures it governs

For each document:
- Add or update 'Related Documents' or 'References' section
- Use table format showing document name, relationship, and purpose
- Ensure bidirectional references where appropriate

Update both .md and .docx versions.

title: P2: Sync docx and Markdown Document Versions
description:
Ensure .docx and .md versions of all GRC documents are synchronized.

Known version mismatches:
1. **RBAC Standard**: docx is v1.0, markdown is v1.1 (missing Appendix B in docx)

For all documents in corporate-grc/:
1. Compare .docx and .md file contents
2. Identify version mismatches
3. Update older version to match newer version
4. Ensure revision history is consistent

Process:
- Use markdown as source of truth (easier to diff/review)
- Convert updated markdown to docx format
- Verify formatting preserved in docx

Files to check:
- corporate-grc/policy/*.docx vs *.md
- corporate-grc/standard/*.docx vs *.md  
- corporate-grc/procedure/*.docx vs *.md

Report any documents that exist only in one format.
close_reason: Synced docx and markdown GRC document versions: updated 4 DOCX files from newer MD sources, created 2 missing MD files, created 1 missing DOCX file. All documents now have both formats synchronized.
